basics.name: Nicholas Carr
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I hope to continue to learn and further strengthen my communications skills after graduation in Spring 2023.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

courses: Curriculum Development, Public Speaking, Training and Technology
Reactor Electronics, Nuclear Physics, Thermal Dynamics, Chemistry
DC Electrical Theory, AC Electrical Theory, Digital Electronics, EFEM

work.summary: Laboratory Assistant for Intro to Programming, Object Oriented Programming and Discrete Math
highlights: Help students to understand concepts and build foundations in computer science.
Develop new ways to deliver complex material to freshman and sophomore students.

work.position: Resident Manager at the Namahana Terrace
highlights: Communication and resolution of building issues.
Answer phone and email responses to Namahana Terrace maintenance queries.

work.summary: Created four different machine learning models to accurately classify maize genotypes by root image scans to support ongoing USDA research.
highlights: Gained experience working with R program language and R studio to implement successful machine models.
Collaborated with biologists and natural resource management experts to deliver a system catered to their needs.

work.summary: Qualified Senior in rate and 3M/QA supervisor
highlights: Maintenance and Battery manager for EE01
Developed Pearl Harbors first fully automated training system
Training Specialist, Ships Tag-out officer, Pre-approved tag out program

volunteer.summary: Small scale construction projects to generate comfortable shelter for those less fortunate.
highlights: Start to finish single bedroom homes in King Bay, Georgia.
Site preparations for larger scale home construction projects in Virginia Beach, VA.
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: Deans List
awards.date: Spring 2020, Fall 2020, Spring 2021, Fall 2021, Spring 2022, Fall 2022

awards.title: Navy Service and Achievement Medal
awards.summary: Awarded for assisting the opposite crew underway with initial sea trials testing for SSBN-736.

awards.title: Navy Service and Achievement Medal
awards.summary: Awarded for improvement of systems monitoring data recording and analysis to better streamline performance monitoring for ships systems overall saving 100's of man-hours a year.

awards.title: Navy Service and Achievement Medal
awards.summary: Awarded for off-duty support for training and qualifying military reserve members in order to generate man-hours placed towards shipyard testing in an extremely time sensitive manner.

awards.title: Navy Service and Achievement Medal
awards.summary: Awarded for full automation of one of PHNSY/IMF largest qualification programs. The automated training process allowed for free-flow qualifications saving thousands of man-hours while also preventing work stoppages. The process developed will pave the way for other required qualification courses across all shipyards, both national and international.
